Clip.Title: SPIRITS OF ORCHID ISLAND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Tao people of this Indo-Pacific island share their stirling example of how to sustain one's environment.

Clip.Title: SOUTH SEA PEARLS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Enter a secretive world of pearl farmers of the Tropical Western Pacific, or the South Seas. Beneath these clear waters, divers risk their lives to puruse a miraculous gem.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join the Bionic Vet and his staff as they tend to a puppy in shock, a police dog in agony and a cat about to take her first (reluctant) dip into the center's hydrotherapy pool.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One thousand miles off the southeast coast of Argentina sits the sub-Antarctic island of South Georgia in the Southern Ocean. About the size of Rhode Island, it's a breathtaking sight - long and narrow - shaped like a huge fractured whalebone. Massive glaciers, ice caps and snowfields cover about 75% of the island, but the land is far from desolate

Clip.Title: SPIRITS OF ORCHID ISLAND
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Tao people of this Indo-Pacific island share their stirling example of how to sustain one's environment.

Clip.Title: SOUTH SEA PEARLS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Enter a secretive world of pearl farmers of the Tropical Western Pacific, or the South Seas. Beneath these clear waters, divers risk their lives to puruse a miraculous gem.

Clip.Title: I HAVE SEEN THE EARTH CHANGE
Clip.Episode: France: Blue Tears of a Glacier
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In the Alps, the climatic change effects are 3 times higher than the world average. The changes in the weather (more rain and less snow) are leading to natural risks as avalanche, floods, and collapse.

Clip.Title: WARSHIPS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: An aerial survey over New Brunswick's Bay of Fundy coastline explores geological wonders, the loyalist city of Saint John and international borders beyond and one of the world's most famous waterways.

Clip.EpisodeSummary: Ride along with a Canadian fleet of Warships as they patrol the Persian Gulf.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From its Great Lakes to its Grand Canyon, its Rocky Mountain peaks to its Key West reefs, America is a land of amazing destinations. This aerial adventure over the nation's most remarkable landscapes and landmarks captures the breathtaking beauty of America, while demonstrating how its sense of wonder has inspired countless artists, thinkers, and revolutionaries.

Clip.Title: AERIAL AMERICA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Zoom above some of America's greatest landcapes and monuments in stunning HD realism.

Clip.Title: SPACE VOYAGES
Clip.EpisodeSummary: A mission to Mars may seem like the stuff of science fiction, but NASA is working to make it a reality. But one big question remains: can the human body withstand this 34-million-mile odyssey? See how modern science is preparing today's astronauts for our next adventures into the deadly void of outer space. The experiences of our first astronauts are helping engineers create new technology to overcome the biggest obstacle to long-term space travel: our human bodies.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: BC's Northern, Coastal Boundary is an epic, high-altitude journey, from Seven Sisters Provincial Park, to Salmon Glacier, and the mountains of the Yellowhead highway.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the creation legends of Naikoon Provincial Park, to rich sea lion colonies, and remote lighthouses - Haida Gwaii's northern coastlines record an epic journey.

Clip.Title: TITANIC: THE BAND PLAYED ON
Clip.EpisodeSummary: When the RMS Titanic set sail across the Atlantic from Southampton on her maiden voyage 100 years ago, she made history. Most potent of all was that of the band standing on deck, bravely playing on until the last lifeboat had left and there was no hope of escape.

Clip.Title: TITANIC'S FINAL MYSTERY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: One century after the sinking of the Titanic, a 20-year investigation reveals the unusual set of circumstances that ultimately led to the ship's tragic demise. Travel back 100 years and witness what really happened in the final hours before and after the Titanic collision.

Clip.Title: U455 - THE MYSTERY OF THE LOST SUBMARINE
Clip.Episode: U455 - The Mystery of the Lost Submarine
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In summer 2008, a mysterious submarine was discovered off the coast of Italy at 120 meters deep. For Lorenzo del Veneziano, an underwater marine archeologist, it was an amazing sight, as the submarine was intact! Could this be the wreck of the long lost U-455, the last missing German U-boat from World War II?
